newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times page one - May 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times page one - May 1.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page on Thursday:

* The U.S. government said that in the first quarter, the economy grew at its fastest pace in more than nine years, and administration officials said the growth would help lower the Federal budget deficit.
* The U.S. Senate confirmed Alexis Herman as Secretary of Labor after two weeks of political wrangling.
* Mexico said it dismantled its lead anti-drug group, recently tarnished by scandal, and would replace it with a new body drawn from a small group of trusted agents.
* Zaire President Mobutu Sese Seko and rebel leader Laurent Kabila agreed to hold their first face-to-face meeting on Friday aboard a ship off Africa's Atlantic Coast.
* New York City Mayor Rudolph Guiliani said the city would end its fiscal year with $800 million more than budget experts forecast less than a year ago.
* Regular exercise can protect women against breast cancer, a study of more than 25,000 Norwegian women suggested.

* An Orthodox Jewish organization plans to sponsor a gathering on September 28 for men who have completed studying the entire Talmud by reading a page daily. The group says it expects to draw a crowd of 70,000.
